entries.content: Perceived lack of credibility is a root cause for objections not being overcome.
entries.notes: Analogous to a witness being seen as a liar, invalidating their testimony.

entries.content: Challenge statements that differ from other information or evidence to identify inconsistencies.
entries.notes: Similar to a lawyer cross-examining to find the truth or root cause of a discrepancy.

entries.content: Being perceived as manipulative or untrustworthy makes you a liability in convincing the prospect.
entries.notes: Directly impacts the ability to address and overcome objections effectively.

entries.content: Seek and rely on vital, verifiable evidence to support claims and overcome doubt.
entries.notes: Solid evidence addresses the root cause of skepticism more effectively than unsupported claims.

entries.content: A witness whose credibility is successfully challenged sees their testimony disregarded, failing to achieve their goal, just as a sales agent loses influence when trust is broken.
entries.notes: Illustrates the consequence of failing to address the root cause of objections related to trust.

focus_area: Objection Discovery: Clarifying questions, isolation, root cause
